p: Oxidative stress observed in a diseased periodontium could result directly from excess reactive oxygen species (ROS) activity or antioxidant deficiency or indirectly by creating a pro-inflammatory state. Some studies reported that the excess production of ROS resulted in damages of gingival tissues, periodontal ligament, and alveolar bone [ 10â€“ 12]. Therefore, the search for an antioxidant that could be used to control these diseases as polyphenolic compounds are likely candidates [ 13].
